Row.Text: Greetings, visitor. I am Tsouharrissen, chief of the Neutral Nation, and you are welcome to feast with us on the glorious bounty of our lands. Take heed though, as any betrayal of our hospitality will be met with fire.
Hail and honour to you, friend. I am Frederick, commander of these forces and King of Prussia. What compels you to seek my audience today?
Tell my wife I said ‘Hello’
Perhaps I should have read Clauswitz more closely.
Back so soon?
You're getting on my nerves. Go bother somebody else.
Please. I do not appreciate this wasting of my time.
Didn't I already say you would have to do better?
I already told you to only bother off ring a fair deal.
Are you offering deals you know I won't accept?
I shall offer to you my heart and ear, for you are my friend and ally.
Greetings.
What would you like to discuss?
What brings you here today?
Go on.
Let us begin.
I grow tired of dealing with wretched churls such as yourself.
Come to beg for mercy?
Lost the will to fight?
What's the matter? Tired of battle?
I have time for a friend. What do you need?
You are not very good at war, it must be said. In fact, you are quite terrible at it.
Best of luck with your war. Perhaps I could give you a few tips?
Your military actions trouble me deeply. I suggest you think carefully about what you're doing.
The positioning of your military is somewhat worrisome. I advise you to withdraw for the sake of future peace. Now, what would you like to talk about?
The spread of your cities and people is like a plague infecting the land. I look forward to the day I don't have to see it any more.
While I have this opportunity, I should mention that your expansion has worried several of my officials. I hope that this does not cause any problems in the future. What would you like to discuss?
I am alarmed by your careless purchase of land near my borders. These fields are the marching grounds of my armies, and I am prepared to defend them if you do not cease at once.
Whilst I have this opportunity, I would like to mention that your recent purchase of land has caused me some concern.
Your military is known the world over; I bow to one who has inspired the souls of men into soldiers.
I have heard word of your prospering nation. My friend, I am pleased for you and your people.
I have little interest in dealing with City-States, thank you.
Where is your army? Did you lose it? That's quite careless of you, don't you think?
I do not wish to speak with you, warmonger.
I consider you a dear friend; would you care to share these sentiments with me, and with the world, in the form of a Declaration of Friendship?
May I call you a friend? That is, with a Declaration of Friendship, of course.
Whilst I think of you as a dear friend, I must first think of the position of my Tribe, and how a declaration of friendship would reflect upon my people.
Friend, I have a serious matter to discuss. My relationship with {1_CivName} has broken down, and I need you to denounce them as a show of support. What do you say?

{1_CivName} has long been given the opportunity to accept harmony with our two nations. They have refused, and the time has come for war. Can I call you my ally, as I would you my friend? (WILL DECLARE WAR IMMEDIATELY)

You have caused enough misery gone unnoticed in this world; it is time that I stood for my Tribe and my honour, and denounced your abominable behaviour.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]They have publicly denounced us! NOTE: You are not at war.[ENDCOLOR])

I will no more tolerate the misdeeds that you have committed against all that is good in this world. I denounce your barbarity.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]They have publicly denounced us! NOTE: You are not at war.[ENDCOLOR])
If this is prelude to war, then you have made a foolish error.
I am sorry that you feel this way; I meant you only courtesy. I hope that one day we may remedy our differences.
You have made a grave mistake.
It is an excellent occasion, that you would declare your friendship with {1_CivName}. There is honour to you yet.
I fear that you have been deceived into friendship by {1_CivName}, for I know in my heart that they are not to be trusted.
I will defend {1_CivName} as if they were of my own Tribe, should it be war that you seek with them.
I am pleased that you have seen through the deceptive nature that is {1_CivName}, and denounced them to the world.
I see that you have become friends with {1_CivName}. I will do the same, and I will hope that it will forge harmony between our nations.
I share your convictions that {1_CivName} only causes problems for the civilized empires of the world. Perhaps the combination of our denouncements will teach them a lesson.
There is no greater dishonour in this world than an alliance between you and {1_CivName}.
Anyone who you don't get along with is clearly worth building a friendship with. Give {1_CivName} my regards.
I see your armies amassed near my empire. If you wish to attack then come. Don't hide in the shadows like a child.
It's come to my attention that you have a large number of Units near my borders. I request that you move them elsewhere to avoid causing undue distress to my citizens.
Your expansion efforts are an insult. Know that there will be consequences for this.
I couldn't help but notice that you seem to be expanding into lands which I regard to be mine. I request that you reconsider this.
The aggressive manner in which you buy up territory near us is an insult. I had hoped you would be a better neighbor.
Your purchase of land is getting out of hand. I will not be afraid to put a stop to it if you cannot control yourself.

It aches my heart that there are villains in this world such as {1_PlayerName:textkey} that can only be dealt with by cannon fire. But so it must be, and I ask you to bear with me this burden, for the sake of all that is good.
{1_PlayerName:textkey} has long been given the opportunity to accept harmony with our two nations. They have refused, and the time has come for war. Can I call you my ally, as I would you my friend?

It's come to my attention that you're getting a little friendly with {1_MinorCivName:textkey}. In case you weren't aware, they're within my sphere of influence, and I'd prefer if you stayed out of it.
We've been over this before. The answer is still no.
Yes. I would prefer to uphold our friendship.
Absolutely not. The land that I settle belongs to those who can defend it greatest.
You deserve nothing but my mockery, sir. You, as a leader, is a laughable thing.
Ah, it's always nice to see my favorite city-state again.
I'm really getting tired of seeing your face. My hope is that one day you'll just go away or something.
Ah, it's you. My apologies. Sometimes I get you mixed up with the barbarians I have to swat from time to time.
Please take better care of your soldiers. I almost mistook them for beggars.
Your army is in terrible shape. It is almost as if you have no clue what it is for.
You are unfit to serve as ruler of your people, for such a poor show of diplomatic skills you have displayed with your bullying.
I can hear your people wailing in sorrow all the way over in my empire. If you don't do something soon they might just pack up and find a real civilization to live in.
With people so unhappy it's a shock to me that they'd keep you around as their leader.
It is understandable that you might have no imperial designs yourself, but think of your people and their needs. Expand a little.
Travelers have told us that your empire's economy is in pretty sad shape. If you beg a little I might give you a hand. Okay, actually I won't.
You are so unrefined. Did you forget to leave the Dark Ages like the rest of us?
There would be a far greater benefit to our two nations should you accept this deal, beyond the economic, I assure you.
I believe there is much to be achieved for our people should we allow them to cross freely between our two nations.
Why have you made such a foolish error?
You are an uncivilized brute.
I expected no less from someone like you.
I relish this chance to defeat you on the battlefield.
Gravely, war must be done upon you.
We both knew this day was looming.
May the better commander win.
The land that you thought was yours indeed belongs to my realm. This is my time to take it back.
Prussia yearns for additional lands. Yours are ripe for the plucking.
So be it. My armies will extract it from your lands then.
There can be no peace. Perhaps another day.
This is not the time for negotiation.
We still have business to settle.
You have done wrong by my realm, and there shall be no peace until justice is wrought.
Our people are now listening to your military marches and wearing your pickelhaubes. I worry the rest of the world will also succumb to the influence of your culture.
We are glad to see that your people are listening to our military marches and wearing our pickelhaubes. The amazing works of our civilization are truly inspiring!
